casebody.data:
The State, ex rel. Donovan, Appellant, v. Portage County Sheriff’s Department et al., Appellees.

[Cite as State, ex rel. Donovan, v. Portage Cty. Sheriffs Dept. (1991), 61 Ohio St.3d 594.]

(No. 91-214 Submitted May 21, 1991 Decided August 28, 1991.) Robert K. Donovan, pro se. Per Curiam.

We hold that the order denying appellant’s motion to proceed in forma pauperis is not a final appealable order. See State, ex rel. Blevins, *595v. Mowrey (1989), 45 Ohio St.3d 20, 24, 543 N.E.2d 99, 103. Accordingly, the appeal is dismissed.

Appeal dismissed.

Moyer, C.J., Sweeney, Holmes, Wright, H. Brown and Resnick, JJ., concur. Douglas, J., dissents.
